newChart
The function is used to create a combination chart.
To learn about the stages of creating a chart, see the
Universal graph dashboard
article.
Syntax
newChart ( )
There are no parameters for the function.
To learn about the stages of creating a chart, see the
Universal graph dashboard
article.
Note
Adding a function to the algorithm code is done from the "Charts" section of the algorithm editor toolbar.
When calling the function, it will insert the algorithm code template, which should be edited as part of the task.
Algorithm template code to build a combination chart:

= newChart()
chart.

//chart.setTitleStyle(Default formatting style for the universal chart title)

chart.xAxis.

chart.xAxis.categories.add(
"January"
)
chart.xAxis.categories.add(

)
chart.xAxis.categories.add(

)

)

)

)
def

= newPieChartSerie()

objId should contain object id.

When calling the function, the code template includes methods for setting the chart title and subtitle styles, with reference to the name of the directory object used by default.
To keep the code functional, these lines are commented out in the article.
When configuring the title/subtitle style, use the
dict
function to select a type instance that is a child of the "Formatting and tooltip styles" [STYLES_DICTIONARY] type, for example,
"Main formatting style"
.
Also, the following fields are used to create the code for the combination chart algorithm:
chart.xAxis.title := "X-axis title" — X-axis name;
chart.yAxis.title := "Y-axis title" — Y-axis name;
chart.xAxis.categories.add("Name") — the name of the category displayed along the X-axis;
chart.yAxis.categories.add("Name") — the name of the category displayed along the Y -axis.
Thus, to create a combination chart:
Enter a line of code, add the names of the axes and categories displayed on the axis.
After that, create a series of the first chart with the specified type, set the parameters of this series and add the data set.
Line of code
Description
def serie := newColumnChartSerie()
Creating a bar chart series
def serie := newLineChartSerie()
Creating a line chart series
def serie := newSplineChartSerie()
Creating a spline chart series
def serie := newPieChartSerie()
Creating a pie donut chart series
3. Then add new charts step by step (it is allowed to use one variable to add a series). The series must also be set with the specified chart type.
To improve the perception of the information it is recommended to use a legend.
4. Complete the entry of all components with the variable used to create the combination chart (by default -
chart
).
Use example
User need to create a chart of the number of transportations on working days and weekends during the spring and summer months. To create such a chart, the following algorithm can be created using the
newChart
function:
Creating a combination chart
def
chart :
= newChart()
//Creating a combination chart
chart.
title :
=
"Combination chart"
chart.
subTitle :
=
"Transportation on working days and weekends"
//Name of the Y-axis and the category displayed on the X-axis
chart.yAxis.
title :
=
""
chart.xAxis.categories.add(
"March"
)
chart.xAxis.categories.add(
"April"
)
chart.xAxis.categories.add(
"May"
)
chart.xAxis.categories.add(
"June"
)
chart.xAxis.categories.add(
"July"
)
chart.xAxis.categories.add(
"August"
)
//Creating a pie series
def
serie :
= newPieChartSerie()
//Series name
serie.
name :
=
"Total consumption"
//Series color set by HTML colors
setChartColors(chart,
'Indigo'
,
'Greenyellow'
)
//Adding series values
serie.values.add(
324
,
"Total on working days"
)
serie.values.add(
242
,
"Total on weekends"
)
//Adding series to the chart
chart.series.add(serie)
//Adding a bar chart series
serie :
= newColumnChartSerie()
//Series name
serie.
name :
=
"Working days"
//Serie color in HEX format
serie.
color :
=
"#ff033e"
//Adding a data set
serie.values.add(
86
)
serie.values.add(
57
)
serie.values.add(
61
)
serie.values.add(
35
)
serie.values.add(
22
)
serie.values.add(
63
)
//Adding series to the chart
chart.series.add(serie)
//Adding a bar chart series
serie :
= newColumnChartSerie()
//Series name
serie.
name :
=
"Weekends"
//Series color in HEX format
serie.
color :
=
"#ffff00"
//Adding series to the chart
serie.values.add(
42
)
serie.values.add(

)
serie.values.add(

)

)

//Adding series to the chart

//Adding a spline chart serie

= newSplineChartSerie()
//Series name
serie.
name :
=
"Averaged"
//Series color
serie.
color :
=
"#FFB800"
//Adding serie values
serie.values.add(
64
)
serie.values.add(

)

)

22
)

55
)
//Adding series to the chart
chart.series.add(serie)
//Returning the given chart
chart
